name: Imgcrossfade
tagline: A jQuery Plugin to easily crossfade through images
body:
![ScreenShot](https://github.com/Koelli91/imgCrossfade/raw/master/tests/banner.png) imgCrossfade v0.1 / 03-02-2016 #####A jQuery Plugin to easily crossfade through images (same dimensions required) Kevin KÃ¶llmann (Koelli91) licensed the [GPL-3.0](https://github.com/Koelli91/imgCrossfade/raw/master/LICENSE) ## #Usage ####Include: ```html ``` ####HTML: ```html
...
``` ####JS: ```js $(document).ready(function() { $("#cycler").imgCrossfade(); }); ``` ####CSS: ```css #cycler { width: 227px; /* the common width of the images */ max-width: 100%; /* for responsiveness - choose whatever max-width you'd like */ } ``` ####View in action: [https://www.kevinkoellmann.de/imgCrossfade/](https://www.kevinkoellmann.de/imgCrossfade/#action) ## ###Features: ``` - Bootstrap-Compatible - Lightweight: ~1 KiB (minified) - Responsive - All browsers (incl. IE6) ``` ###Options: ```js $("#cycler").imgCrossfade({ fading: 'fast'|'medium'|'slow'| interval: }); /* * fading: how long the crossfade should take (Default: 'medium' (= 1500 ms)) * interval: how often the image should change (Default: 7000 ms) */ ```
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
